entries.meaning: (card games) A winning of all the tricks in the game of piquet, counting for forty points.
examples: There are three chances in this game, viz., the repique, pique, and capot […] The Capot is , when either of the Players make every Trick , for which he is to count forty ; instead of which he counts but ten , when he only gets the Majority of the Tricks, which is called , the Cards

verbs.description: capot (third-person singular simple present capots, present participle capotting or capoting, simple past and past participle capotted or capoted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To win all the tricks (from), when playing at piquet.
examples: “Capot me if I think that was according to the rules of the game,” said his confident ; “ and pray , what answer did you return ?”
